speaker: Second Musician
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: Second Musician
text_entry: SCENE I. Mantua. A street.

speaker: Second Musician
text_entry: Enter ROMEO

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: If I may trust the flattering truth of sleep,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: My dreams presage some joyful news at hand:

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: My bosom's lord sits lightly in his throne;

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And all this day an unaccustom'd spirit

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Lifts me above the ground with cheerful thoughts.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: I dreamt my lady came and found me dead--

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Strange dream, that gives a dead man leave

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: to think!--

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And breathed such life with kisses in my lips,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: That I revived, and was an emperor.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Ah me! how sweet is love itself possess'd,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: When but love's shadows are so rich in joy!

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Enter BALTHASAR, booted

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: News from Verona!--How now, Balthasar!

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Dost thou not bring me letters from the friar?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: How doth my lady? Is my father well?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: How fares my Juliet? that I ask again;

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: For nothing can be ill, if she be well.

speaker: BALTHASAR
text_entry: Then she is well, and nothing can be ill:

speaker: BALTHASAR
text_entry: Her body sleeps in Capel's monument,

speaker: BALTHASAR
text_entry: And her immortal part with angels lives.

speaker: BALTHASAR
text_entry: I saw her laid low in her kindred's vault,

speaker: BALTHASAR
text_entry: And presently took post to tell it you:

speaker: BALTHASAR
text_entry: O, pardon me for bringing these ill news,

speaker: BALTHASAR
text_entry: Since you did leave it for my office, sir.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Is it even so? then I defy you, stars!

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Thou know'st my lodging: get me ink and paper,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And hire post-horses; I will hence to-night.

speaker: BALTHASAR
text_entry: I do beseech you, sir, have patience:

speaker: BALTHASAR
text_entry: Your looks are pale and wild, and do import

speaker: BALTHASAR
text_entry: Some misadventure.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Tush, thou art deceived:

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Leave me, and do the thing I bid thee do.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Hast thou no letters to me from the friar?

speaker: BALTHASAR
text_entry: No, my good lord.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: No matter: get thee gone,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And hire those horses; I'll be with thee straight.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Exit BALTHASAR

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Well, Juliet, I will lie with thee to-night.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Let's see for means: O mischief, thou art swift

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: To enter in the thoughts of desperate men!

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: I do remember an apothecary,--

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And hereabouts he dwells,--which late I noted

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: In tatter'd weeds, with overwhelming brows,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Culling of simples; meagre were his looks,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Sharp misery had worn him to the bones:

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And in his needy shop a tortoise hung,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: An alligator stuff'd, and other skins

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Of ill-shaped fishes; and about his shelves

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: A beggarly account of empty boxes,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Green earthen pots, bladders and musty seeds,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Remnants of packthread and old cakes of roses,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Were thinly scatter'd, to make up a show.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Noting this penury, to myself I said

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: 'An if a man did need a poison now,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Whose sale is present death in Mantua,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Here lives a caitiff wretch would sell it him.'

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: O, this same thought did but forerun my need;

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And this same needy man must sell it me.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: As I remember, this should be the house.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Being holiday, the beggar's shop is shut.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: What, ho! apothecary!

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Enter Apothecary

speaker: Apothecary
text_entry: Who calls so loud?

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Come hither, man. I see that thou art poor:

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Hold, there is forty ducats: let me have

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: A dram of poison, such soon-speeding gear

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: As will disperse itself through all the veins

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: That the life-weary taker may fall dead

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And that the trunk may be discharged of breath

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: As violently as hasty powder fired

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Doth hurry from the fatal cannon's womb.

speaker: Apothecary
text_entry: Such mortal drugs I have; but Mantua's law

speaker: Apothecary
text_entry: Is death to any he that utters them.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Art thou so bare and full of wretchedness,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: And fear'st to die? famine is in thy cheeks,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Need and oppression starveth in thine eyes,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Contempt and beggary hangs upon thy back;

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: The world is not thy friend nor the world's law;

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: The world affords no law to make thee rich;

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Then be not poor, but break it, and take this.

speaker: Apothecary
text_entry: My poverty, but not my will, consents.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: I pay thy poverty, and not thy will.

speaker: Apothecary
text_entry: Put this in any liquid thing you will,

speaker: Apothecary
text_entry: And drink it off; and, if you had the strength

speaker: Apothecary
text_entry: Of twenty men, it would dispatch you straight.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: There is thy gold, worse poison to men's souls,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Doing more murders in this loathsome world,

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Than these poor compounds that thou mayst not sell.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: I sell thee poison; thou hast sold me none.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Farewell: buy food, and get thyself in flesh.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Come, cordial and not poison, go with me

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: To Juliet's grave; for there must I use thee.

speaker: ROMEO
text_entry: Exeunt
